alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 3:57PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Kit Carson County through 430 PM MDT... At 356 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles southeast of Cope to 7 miles northwest of Vona to 4 miles west of Seibert. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Seibert around 400 PM MDT. Vona around 405 PM MDT. Stratton around 415 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Bethune. This includes Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 402 and 430. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
